Stop by any ImagineIF location this week, grab a book and cozy up with a warm beverage on us. While you're here, answer our prompt, or tell us here:
What made you smile today?
What do you like about our town?
Which accomplishment are you most proud of? https://t.co/L0Tizrr8Bx

The ImagineIF Library Foundation's "Read Between the Wines" fundraiser for the new Bigfork Library was a success last night. 
Thanks to journalist and award winning Author Abe Streep for a powerful talk that included the importance of libraries. #librariesmatter https://t.co/77MLYXhhzz

Fall Early Literacy Classes launch September 6th! We're excited to offer new, creative storytimes followed by hands-on learning activities. Join us. Especially for children ages 0-5. Find out more at: https://t.co/XAxEBqGLXW https://t.co/86p3hO4OPg

There's a lot going on this September at ImagineIF. Storytime returns, new programming for teens kicks off, and new art exhibits at the library!  Read about it in this month's eNewsletter.  https://t.co/XolI4cSPe2 https://t.co/bd5PHK91xa

September is National Library Card Sign-up Month! Sign-up for a library card or our email newsletter in September and score free ImagineIF merch! While supplies last. #LibraryCardSignUpMonth https://t.co/YnohOzHeHZ

This month we wrapped up Summer Experience. Thousands of kids and teens from around the valley explored, learned and played with us. Thanks to our Youth Services and Teen Services teams for putting together amazing hands-on learning activities. https://t.co/DiKtNuQjuM

Wyatt and Ray Ray met at ImagineIF CFalls during storytime in Nov 21. They became fast friends and discovered they live across the highway from each other. One of their fave things is exploring the library together. How has the #library has impacted your life? https://t.co/rUIk73tnAy
@eattheapple4 Yes! We design new gameboards for our Summer Experience program every year! We also have great programming coming up this fall!

This is the last week for kids and teens to turn in their gameboards and pick out a prize! Stop by any ImagineIF location this week and show us your work. We love to see what you did this summer! https://t.co/w4SwqyWGDs

Last week we found these sticky notes in some books that were returned to the library. Thanks to whoever wrote these. It made ImagineIF staff smile. We are glad you love the library! https://t.co/SLGBEED5bo

Read & Play launches today! Check out books and explore interactive activities in the kids dept. Read & Play will replace our weekly storytimes through Sept 5 so our team can prepare new activities for fall. Programs for all ages will return starting Sept 6. https://t.co/7pa86W36YB

An emotional moment as Sean Anderson, Martha Furman and Starr White received a standing ovation at the Tri-Conference Awards held in Missoula on Aug 5, 2022. @micahddrew received the Media Award for his library coverage. Join us in offering congratulations. https://t.co/Dkp4pZvk1G

Wed morning ImagineIF Library staff discovered donated books that have been damaged by a firearm. Out of caution, we closed the Library while KPD investigated.
All Library locations resumed normal operations Aug 4. Read statement from Director: https://t.co/HhouhgXXQu

Wrap up your summer at ImagineIF with hands-on activities at the library, and storytime at the pool. Don't forget to turn in your Summer Experience gameboards by August 20th! Find out more in the month's eNewsletter.  https://t.co/F0mPOyFN4a https://t.co/oPRPLEqJ14

We had so much fun at the Parkline Ribbon Cutting ceremony yesterday at Depot Park in Kalispell. Tony the Library Guy got to meet local celebrities and play with kids at ImagineIF's play area. What a great way to celebrate new places for the community to come together. https://t.co/RaSc8iXgxf

@MNealDoherty Thanks for recognizing our work! The staff at ImagineIF are dedicated offering hands-on learning and free access to information to all people. That has not changed. We hope people continue to visit our libraries.

Young scientists gathered at our Science Lab at ImagineIF Kalispell this week for our Mix It Up activity. Youngsters put on a lab coat and experimented with bubbly concoctions. This activity moves to Columbia Falls on August 1st and 4th. You don't want to miss it! https://t.co/qJLaQhYd9d

Our Teen Bioactive Enclosures workshop has been popular at our Kalispell location. The science and design-packed activity moves to Columbia Falls next week on July 25th from 2-3:30pm. 

Space is limited. Register at https://t.co/fjWYpLu3oy! https://t.co/A0ThbQqciM

Special thanks to the Boys and Girls Club of Glacier Country for partnering with the Girls Scouts to grow 60 plants for ImagineIF's Native Plant Garden, and for also volunteering to help us plant the garden! https://t.co/IlbHgY74xS

Our DIY Foraging Pouch activity has moved to ImagineIF Bigfork this week! Create your own needle felted foraging pouch and learn about what wild treats can be found in Flathead County. This activity was a hit for all ages last week at the Kalispell location. Don't miss it! https://t.co/lm12zDWRsX

Storytime at the Pool returns to Woodland Water Park! Stay cool while we dive into special water themed stories that'll be sure to make a splash. For children 0-5 with a caregiver. Free admission. July 15 & 29, 10:30-11:30am. https://t.co/E2M2e2Bqzi

Today is #NationalVideoGameDay! Teens can celebrate their love of gaming during our Merch Meetup event going on all summer at each ImagineIF location. Play Nintendo Switch with other gaming enthusiasts! Register at: https://t.co/fjWYpLu3oy https://t.co/HjbKOBeZaS

Summer Experience is in full swing, storytime at the pool returns, join us for a local artist meet and greet, and participate in Citizen Science projects.  There's something for everyone this summer at ImagineIF!  https://t.co/G32QF5sKtt https://t.co/aWlUOZPzCc

Keep kids engaged in reading, math and art over the summer and prevent summer slide! Join us all summer long for free early literacy programs packed with science, art, and hands-on fun. Find out more at https://t.co/NLMEw9zjpj. https://t.co/QMBXZId0nw

Teens! Don't miss the local fandom event of the summer! We'll create our own swag, listen to music, discuss summer fandom news and releases, and play video games. *Space is limited. Register at: https://t.co/fjWYpLu3oy. https://t.co/Vgwf6cmdBx

Yesterday we said goodbye to longtime ImagineIF Board member Connie Leistiko, and celebrated her 14 years of service to the Library. All current members of the Library Board gathered to thank her, as well as former Board Chair, Al Logan. https://t.co/DBQE9u0GKc

We're looking for young farmers to sell produce at the market! Our new Farmers Market stand at the Kalispell location is a hit. Come check it out this month. While you're here, explore the other hands-on activities we've designed for littles. https://t.co/zM7dKGxOO5

Our Bee House activity has moved to Columbia Falls this week! Come paint a bee house at the library and build a take-home kit to create your own been nesting tube house. Hang it in your yard to attract pollinators! Available through June 18th. #DIYbeehouse https://t.co/UPP2mmYw8e

All library locations will be closed for a staff in-service day on Monday, June 6th. We will resume or regular schedule on June 7th. Thanks for your understand. https://t.co/AOKvZQN2LL

The correct dates of the Friends of the Library Book Sale are June 10th-11th at Kalispell Center Mall. Thousands of items will be for sale, with all proceeds benefiting ImagineIF Libraries. Buy books and support the library programs you love! https://t.co/FrDpJ6OcHQ

How cool is this? Girl Scouts of MT have planted seedlings and are tending them in the greenhouse at Boys and Girls Club of Glacier County. They will plant them in our new Native Plant Garden at #ImagineIF Kalispell this summer! Volunteer at: https://t.co/F9E78Z4TwW https://t.co/4p77oYh57l
